Description: Triangular limestone ostracon: On the recto a palimpsest, five lines of an almost complete text containing a list of workmen receiving lamps (ḫʒbʒs). On the verso two(?) almost completely faded lines of the beginning of a hymn(?).
Curator's comments: The text on the verso might well contain the opening lines of the 'Satire of Trades', though the remaining signs after ẖnw do not fit. For edition of the Teaching of Khety (so-called Satire on Trades): S. Jäger Altägyptische Berufstypologien (Lingua Aegyptia Studia Monographica 4, 2004). Translation : Parkinson, The Tale of Sinuhe and Other Ancient Egyptian Poems 1940–1649 BC. (Oxford World’s Classics 1999), 273-83.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136386) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136386)
